  • Sep 21, 2017

    I‚Äôve gone back to my roots. After switching blogging platforms and moving my blog to several different domain names, I‚Äôm just going back to where it all started. With the ability to long form post here on micro.blog, the great community that‚Äôs building here, and the indy web movement, I‚Äôve decided to just post it all on chadmoore.net with micro.blog as my blogging platform.

    I‚Äôve had this domain for years, and though about moving away from it, as there‚Äôs a photographer by the same name. In an effort to avoid confusion. But anyone who knows me online from my past life as an animator, and game developer remembers that url. I think the other Chad won‚Äôt mind. Our web presences are pretty different.

  • Sep 21, 2017

    Rob Hope posted a nice note on Motivation. I fall on and off the wagon with what he‚Äôs mentioned in point 1 and 2 too much. I‚Äôm not doing enough of either of those items regularly right now. I need to get back on track with those.

    One of the other ways I find great personal motivation is sending a ‚Äúthank you‚Äù note to people who are doing work I admire.

    I‚Äôm Grateful
    I have a great deal of respect for the independent technical & creative folks out there. I aspire to be a part timer in that space myself. I am inspired by the work of people who are working on their own terms and ideas. The good things they are putting out into the world show me that there are endless ideas.

    I‚Äôm grateful to them for showing what they‚Äôve worked on, and when they discuss how they do their thing, I eat that up too. I try not to Compare their Backstage to my onstage, and It‚Äôs so uplifting and inspiring to see others succeed.

    So I tend to send a brief email or DM. Really nothing more than a ‚ÄúI like your work, and that thing you did with X really helped me do Y, thanks, have a great day‚Äù. More often than not, I don‚Äôt get a reply. But that‚Äôs not the point. It‚Äôs not about counting ‚ÄòLikes‚Äô or ‚ÄòFollowers‚Äô. It‚Äôs about expressing appreciation for someones hard work.

    Maybe they never read it. Maybe they did and didn‚Äôt have the time or inclination to reply. This isn‚Äôt something you can control. You can send these type of notes, and it uplifts you. Something about writing my feelings down really helps me express them better.

    Science
    There‚Äôs all kinds of science around the act of expressing gratitude.

    My reading indicates that expressing gratitude makes people stronger mentally and physically.

    Maybe the Beastie Boys said it best:

    Good times gone but you feed it
    Hate‚Äôs grown strong, you feel you need it
    Just one thing, do you know you?
    What you think, that the world owes you?
    What‚Äôs gonna set you free?
    Look inside and you‚Äôll see
    When you‚Äôve got so much to say it‚Äôs called gratitude
    And that‚Äôs right

    I am grateful that you took the time to read this.
